xml

Class XMLExporter

  • java.lang.Object
    • xml.XMLExporter

  • public class XMLExporter
extends java.lang.Object
    Exports requirement analysis to given address in given format. The XMLExporter is called from the XMLManager.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    3852430
    See Also:
    FileOperator, SecurityManager

    • Method Detail

      • save

        public void save(IRequirementAnalysis analysis,
                 java.lang.String address,
                 XMLFormatType type)
          throws XMLMarschallingException,
                 java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                 XMLFormatException,
                 SingletonRecreationException,
                 javax.xml.bind.JAXBException,
                 java.lang.SecurityException
        A requirement analysis is marshaled and exported in a given format. The method marshall(IRequirementAnalysis, XMLFormatType) is used to create a new requirement analysis in a format that JAXB can process. This requirement analysis is converted by JAXB to the XML file in the saveTo(String, IXMLFormat) method.
        Parameters:
        analysis - The requirement analysis to be converted.
        address - The address in the filesystem where the XML file should be stored.
        type - The XML format in which the requirement analysis should be formatted.
        Throws:
        XMLMarschallingException - Is thrown, when the given requirement analysis could not be parsed to the given type
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - Is thrown, when the XML file is not found.
        XMLFormatException - Is thrown, when the given format is invalid.
        SingletonRecreationException - Is thrown, whenever there is an attempt to create two instances of a singleton
        javax.xml.bind.JAXBException - Is thrown, when an error occurred while processing the requirement analysis to the file in JAXB
        java.lang.SecurityException - Is thrown, when there is no write permission for the given file
